intro: Dimerostemma lippioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to red. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in pine flatwoods. Dimerostemma lippioides is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to humid, subtropical climates.
